channel.title: Comments on: Hot air ballooning in Cappadocia: the best airborne experience you can have

item.title: By: Noon Moon
item.dc:creator: Noon Moon
item.description:
We are three adults in a group and we would like to take Hot Balloon Ride on February 10, 2015. We will be at the hotel Lykia Loadge Kappadocia. Please let us know the cost.
Thanks,
item.content:encoded:
We are three adults in a group and we would like to take Hot Balloon Ride on February 10, 2015. We will be at the hotel Lykia Loadge Kappadocia.
Please let us know the cost.

Thanks,

item.title: By: Sarah Duff » The best views on Turkey’s Turquoise Coast: Yediburunlar Lighthouse
item.dc:creator: Sarah Duff » The best views on Turkey’s Turquoise Coast: Yediburunlar Lighthouse
item.description: [...] I marvelled at some pretty spectacular vistas, from the minaret-encrusted skyline of Istanbul to panoramas over Cappadocia on a hot air balloon ride. The pinnacle of my viewing pleasure came at the end of a tiny winding road through a countryside [...]
item.content:encoded: […] I marvelled at some pretty spectacular vistas, from the minaret-encrusted skyline of Istanbul to panoramas over Cappadocia on a hot air balloon ride. The pinnacle of my viewing pleasure came at the end of a  tiny winding road through a countryside […]

item.title: By: Sarah Duff » 10 things I loved about magical Cappadocia
item.dc:creator: Sarah Duff » 10 things I loved about magical Cappadocia
item.description: [...] If this isn’t on your bucket list, it should be. You lift off at dawn surrounded by about 100 other hot air balloons filled with people mesmerised by the sight of golden sunlight spreading across the magical Cappadocian landscape. (Read more about how awesome hot air ballooning in Cappadocia is here.) [...]
item.content:encoded: […] If this isn’t on your bucket list, it should be. You lift off at dawn surrounded by about 100 other hot air balloons filled with people mesmerised by the sight of golden sunlight spreading across the magical Cappadocian landscape. (Read more about how awesome hot air ballooning in Cappadocia is here.) […]

item.title: By: Sarah Duff » Luxury cave living in Cappadocia
item.dc:creator: Sarah Duff » Luxury cave living in Cappadocia
item.description: [...] most excited me about visiting Cappadocia, in central Turkey, other than hot air ballooning over fairy chimneys with a hundred other balloons littering the sky, was the prospect of staying in a cave hotel. Cappadocia’s landscape is covered in surreal [...]
